art_direction: The art should evoke the feeling of a cursed, decaying Gilded Age hotel, where the very architecture is alive and malevolent. The pixel art style should be painterly and detailed, emphasizing texture—peeling wallpaper, dusty velvet, and tarnished brass—all under a suffocating sepia light.

scenes.title: The Silent Atrium
scenes.text: You stand within the grand atrium of the Hotel Veridian, a place seemingly forgotten by time. A profound and sepulchral silence reigns here, so thick you can feel its weight pressing upon your skin, a velvet shroud smothering all but the frantic beat of your own heart. Dust motes dance like frantic sprites in the wan light filtering through a grime-caked skylight far above, illuminating the peeling gold leaf on the towering columns. Ahead, a long, imposing reception desk of dark mahogany sits vacant, while to your left, a magnificent, curving staircase sweeps upward into the gloom.
scenes.image_prompt: A grand, decaying hotel lobby. In the center is a massive, empty reception desk made of dark wood. To the left, a grand staircase with an ornate banister curves up into darkness. Dust hangs in the air. 32-bit painterly pixel horror, retro game aesthetic, cinematic first-person perspective, through your eyes, dim ambient lighting, soft diffused shadows, vintage sepia tones, aged brown hues, subtle film grain.

scenes.title: The Gaping Keyhole
scenes.text: You drift toward the reception desk, your footsteps swallowed by the plush, yet threadbare, crimson carpet. The polished wood is cold beneath your fingertips. Behind the desk, a wall of cubbyholes for room keys stands mostly empty, save for a single, ornate brass key hanging from a hook marked 'Workshop.' Suddenly, a low groan emanates from the desk itself, and you see the brass keyhole of a central drawer warp and stretch, forming a screaming, cavernous mouth. It is the face of the Concierge, a being of fused wood and flesh, and it hungers.
scenes.image_prompt: Looking over a dark mahogany reception desk in a decaying hotel. In the center of the desk, a brass keyhole has distorted into a screaming mouth. Behind the desk, a single ornate brass key hangs on a wall of key hooks. 32-bit painterly pixel horror, retro game aesthetic, cinematic first-person perspective, through your eyes, dim ambient lighting, soft diffused shadows, vintage sepia tones, aged brown hues, subtle film grain.

choices.text: Back away slowly and go to the staircase.

scenes.title: The Weeping Ascent
scenes.text: You turn to the staircase, its steps groaning as if in pain under your weight. The air grows colder with each step. As you climb, you notice the floral patterns on the damask wallpaper seem to writhe, the petals twisting into agonized human faces. A faint, wet sound reaches your ears, and you see tears of brackish water seeping from their painted eyes, tracing paths through the grime. A distant cry, thin and mournful, echoes from the floors above, a sound of profound and eternal sorrow.
scenes.image_prompt: Climbing a wide, carpeted staircase in a haunted hotel. The ornate, floral wallpaper on the right wall is subtly shifting, with tormented faces visible within the pattern, weeping dark liquid. Your hand is visible on the dusty wooden banister. 32-bit painterly pixel horror, retro game aesthetic, cinematic first-person perspective, through your eyes, dim ambient lighting, soft diffused shadows, vintage sepia tones, aged brown hues, subtle film grain.

choices.text: Continue up to the second-floor landing.

scenes.title: The Upholsterer's Key
scenes.text: With a surge of adrenaline, you lunge forward, your fingers closing around the cold, heavy brass of the Workshop key. The screaming keyhole-mouth of the Concierge shrieks, a sound like tearing metal and splintering wood. A long, spindly arm, seemingly made of twisted mahogany and jutting bone, erupts from a drawer and swipes at you, its sharpened fingers grazing your arm. You recoil, clutching the key, the creature's shriek of fury chasing you as you flee toward the nearest hallway.
scenes.image_prompt: A first-person view of a hand clutching an ornate brass key, pulling it away from a hook. In the background, a monstrous arm made of dark wood and bone is emerging from a desk drawer, reaching for you. 32-bit painterly pixel horror, retro game aesthetic, cinematic first-person perspective, through your eyes, dim ambient lighting, soft diffused shadows, vintage sepia tones, aged brown hues, subtle film grain.

scenes.title: Woven into the Walls
scenes.text: An inexplicable compulsion guides your hand. You reach out, your fingertips brushing against the damp, textured wallpaper. The moment you make contact, the face beneath the pattern lunges forward. The wall becomes pliant, like thick cloth, and skeletal hands wrapped in fabric shoot out, seizing your arm. You are pulled inexorably into the wall, your own scream joining the muffled chorus of despair as your flesh is unraveled and re-stitched into the hotel's eternal, agonizing design.
scenes.image_prompt: A hand is being pulled into a floral wallpaper, which has become fluid and fabric-like. Skeletal hands made of threads are wrapped around the wrist, dragging it into the wall where a screaming face is visible. 32-bit painterly pixel horror, retro game aesthetic, cinematic first-person perspective, through your eyes, dim ambient lighting, soft diffused shadows, vintage sepia tones, aged brown hues, subtle film grain.

scenes.title: The Gallery of Gazes
scenes.text: You reach the second-floor landing, a long gallery lined with portraits of stern-faced patrons. Their eyes, rendered in oil paint centuries ago, seem unnervingly alive. They follow you as you walk, their painted lips seeming to curl into silent judgment. The air is heavy with the scent of turpentine and decay. At the far end of the hall is a set of grand double doors, slightly ajar, from which a faint, lilting music box melody can be heard. To your right is a single, unmarked door of dark oak.

At the far end of the hall, light seeps from under a set of double doors. 32-bit painterly pixel horror, retro game aesthetic, cinematic first-person perspective, through your eyes, dim ambient lighting, soft diffused shadows, vintage sepia tones, aged brown hues, subtle film grain.

scenes.title: The Ballroom of Stitched Dancers
scenes.text: You push open the heavy doors and step into a vast, derelict ballroom. The music box tune is louder here, a tinny, melancholic waltz. In the center of the floor, several figures turn in a slow, graceful dance. As your eyes adjust, you see they are not human, but amalgams of broken furniture, shredded finery, and human limbs, all crudely stitched together with thick, black thread. Their movements are jerky, puppeteered by an unseen force, their sewn-on faces frozen in expressions of vacant bliss.
scenes.image_prompt: A vast, dusty ballroom with a checkered floor. In the center, grotesque figures made of furniture parts, torn dresses, and human limbs are slowly waltzing to unseen music. Light streams from a high, dirty window. 32-bit painterly pixel horror, retro game aesthetic, cinematic first-person perspective, through your eyes, dim ambient lighting, soft diffused shadows, vintage sepia tones, aged brown hues, subtle film grain.

choices.text: Search the room for a way out.

scenes.title: The Upholsterer's Workshop
scenes.text: You find a door with a simple brass plaque, so tarnished you can barely read the word: 'Workshop.' The key you hold slips into the lock with a satisfying, oily click. The room beyond is a place of meticulous horror. Bolts of strange fabric—some patterned like damask, others disturbingly like flayed skin—are stacked to the ceiling. Spools of thread made from hair and sinew litter a heavy workbench. In the center of the bench rests a massive, ledger-like book and a long, wicked-looking needle of polished bone.

scenes.title: The Tapestry Hound
scenes.text: You stumble back into the hall, your heart hammering against your ribs. The portraits' eyes now burn with a malevolent red light. A guttural snarl echoes from the end of the corridor, and a creature lurches into view. It is a hound-like beast, its body woven from strips of tattered carpet and upholstery, its legs bent chair-legs, and its teeth shards of broken porcelain. It pads toward you, its patchwork form seeming to absorb the light around it, leaving only a trail of profound darkness.

The portraits on the wall now have glowing red eyes. 32-bit painterly pixel horror, retro game aesthetic, cinematic first-person perspective, through your eyes, dim ambient lighting, soft diffused shadows, vintage sepia tones, aged brown hues, subtle film grain.

scenes.title: The Conductor's Platform
scenes.text: Ignoring the grotesque dancers, you scan the ballroom's perimeter. On a small, raised dais where an orchestra might have played, you see a conductor's lectern. Atop it rests not a sheet of music, but a single, strange silver key, pulsing with a faint, internal light. As you approach, the music box melody falters, and the stitched dancers all stop, their heads creaking as they turn in unison to face you. Their empty eyes fix upon your form.

In the background, stitched-together mannequin-like figures have stopped dancing and are staring directly at you. 32-bit painterly pixel horror, retro game aesthetic, cinematic first-person perspective, through your eyes, dim ambient lighting, soft diffused shadows, vintage sepia tones, aged brown hues, subtle film grain.

choices.text: Take the silver key and run.

scenes.title: A Legacy of Sinew
scenes.text: You open the heavy ledger. The spidery script details the arcane art of 'soul upholstery'—a pact made by your ancestor, the first Upholsterer, to grant the hotel immortality by weaving the souls of its guests into its very structure. You are his bloodline, drawn here by the hotel to become its new caretaker. The final page describes a ritual of unraveling, a way to release the souls, but it requires the Bone Needle and the 'Heart of the Hotel'—the ancient, roaring furnace in the basement.
scenes.image_prompt: Looking down at an ancient, leather-bound book. The pages are filled with spidery handwriting and macabre diagrams of stitching human souls into fabric. Your hands are visible at the edge of the pages. 32-bit painterly pixel horror, retro game aesthetic, cinematic first-person perspective, through your eyes, dim ambient lighting, soft diffused shadows, vintage sepia tones, aged brown hues, subtle film grain.

choices.text: Take up the Bone Needle and find the furnace.
Embrace your legacy. Become the new Upholsterer.

scenes.title: The Thread of Purpose
scenes.text: You ignore the book and grasp the Bone Needle. It is cold, yet it seems to thrum with a life of its own, a deep vibration that resonates in your very marrow. Whispers fill your mind, not of horror, but of purpose. You see the hotel not as a prison, but as a grand, unfinished tapestry. You understand the intricate stitch-work, the way a soul can be woven to create beauty from sorrow. The needle is a part of you now. You know what must be done.
scenes.image_prompt: A close-up shot of a hand holding a long, smooth needle made of polished white bone. The needle glows faintly. In the background, the dark workshop is slightly out of focus. 32-bit painterly pixel horror, retro game aesthetic, cinematic first-person perspective, through your eyes, dim ambient lighting, soft diffused shadows, vintage sepia tones, aged brown hues, subtle film grain.

choices.text: Find the furnace to begin the unraveling.

scenes.title: The Heart of the Hotel
scenes.text: Clutching the Bone Needle, you descend into the hotel's depths, guided by a deep, rhythmic thrumming. You find the boiler room. A colossal, iron furnace, riveted with brass and glowing with infernal heat, dominates the space. This is the Heart. The thrumming is the collective heartbeat of every soul trapped within these walls. You see a small, tarnished plaque on its iron door. To begin the unraveling, you must plunge the needle into the Heart's core.
scenes.image_prompt: Standing in a dark, stone basement before a massive, ancient iron furnace. The furnace door glows with a hellish orange light from within. A small brass plaque is visible on the door. Your hand, holding a bone needle, is raised. 32-bit painterly pixel horror, retro game aesthetic, cinematic first-person perspective, through your eyes, dim ambient lighting, soft diffused shadows, vintage sepia tones, aged brown hues, subtle film grain.

choices.text: Plunge the needle into the furnace.

scenes.title: The New Upholsterer
scenes.text: You leave the needle and the book. You understand now. This is not a curse, but an inheritance. You walk from the workshop with a newfound purpose. The hotel breathes with you, its halls your veins, its rooms your heart. You return to the lobby to face the screaming Concierge. It falls silent as you approach, bowing its grotesque form. It recognizes its new master. The work is endless, and there are so many new patterns to create. You are home.
scenes.image_prompt: Standing in the grand hotel lobby, but viewed with a sense of power and ownership. The monstrous Concierge, a being of wood and flesh, is bowing low before you in a gesture of servitude. 32-bit painterly pixel horror, retro game aesthetic, cinematic first-person perspective, through your eyes, dim ambient lighting, soft diffused shadows, vintage sepia tones, aged brown hues, subtle film grain.

scenes.title: The Great Unraveling
scenes.text: You thrust the Bone Needle into the furnace's core. A blinding white light erupts, and a single, harmonious chord rings through the hotel, a sound of pure, unadulterated release. The wallpaper peels away, the furniture splinters, the very floorboards groan as spectral forms of light rise from them. Thousands of souls, freed from their gilded suture, swirl around you in a vortex of grateful energy before ascending through the ceiling. The hotel groans its last, and as the dust settles, you see the morning sun streaming through a clean glass window for the first time. You are free.

A bright, clean sunbeam cuts through the dust and decay from a window. 32-bit painterly pixel horror, retro game aesthetic, cinematic first-person perspective, through your eyes, dim ambient lighting, soft diffused shadows, vintage sepia tones, aged brown hues, subtle film grain.

scenes.title: The Dead End
scenes.text: You turn and sprint down the hallway, the creature's claws scraping on the floorboards behind you. You throw open door after door—all of them open into brick walls. The hotel is playing with you, building your terror before the inevitable end. You reach the final door at the end of the hall, your last hope. You wrench it open and find only a small, dark closet. As you turn, the Tapestry Hound fills the doorway, its porcelain teeth glinting in the dark.
scenes.image_prompt: Trapped in a small, dark closet, looking out. The doorway is completely blocked by the silhouette of the monstrous Tapestry Hound, a creature of carpet and furniture. Its jagged, porcelain-shard teeth are the only things clearly visible. 32-bit painterly pixel horror, retro game aesthetic, cinematic first-person perspective, through your eyes, dim ambient lighting, soft diffused shadows, vintage sepia tones, aged brown hues, subtle film grain.

scenes.title: A Futile Stand
scenes.text: There is nowhere to run. You grab a tarnished silver candlestick from a nearby table, a pathetic weapon against the monstrosity before you. The Tapestry Hound lunges, not with speed, but with an unnatural, flowing motion, like a carpet being unrolled. It crashes into you, the force throwing you to the ground. You feel not a bite, but a suffocating embrace as its fibrous body envelops you, its threads working their way into your mouth and nose, silencing you forever.
